TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the SP ” ) , the first applicant , was a political party that was dissolved by ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , the second and third applicants , were respectively Chairman and former Chairman of the ORG . They live in GPE .

CARDINAL . The ORG was formed on DATE . On DATE , its constitution and programme were submitted to the office of ORG at ORG for assessment of their compatibility with LAW and Law no . PERSON on the regulation of political parties ( “ PERSON no . CARDINAL ” – see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE , when the ORG was preparing to take part in a general election , ORG at ORG ( “ ORG Counsel ” ) applied to ORG for an order dissolving the ORG . Relying in particular on passages from its programme , he accused the party of having sought to establish the domination of the working class with a view to establishing a dictatorship of the proletariat ( Articles CARDINAL , DATE and DATE and former LAW and sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) of PERSON no . MONEY ) .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , published in ORG of CARDINAL DATE , ORG dismissed the application as unfounded , as it considered that the political objectives stated in the ORG 's programme did not infringe the LAW .

CARDINAL . Criminal proceedings were then brought in ORG against some of the leaders of the ORG , including PERSON . They were accused of spreading harmful propaganda in favour of the domination of one social class over the others , contrary to LAW , as then worded ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . The allegation against PERSON was based in particular on speeches he had made at CARDINAL public meetings on DATE at ORG and DATE at Van and on an article that had appeared in a political journal on CARDINAL DATE , that is to say before his election as Chairman of the ORG on DATE . Following the repeal of LAW of LAW by Law no . ORG of DATE ( the Prevention of Terrorism Act ) , the accused were all acquitted . The ORG later published the speeches in question under the titles : “ PERSON , PERSON ateşi yaktı ” and “ FAC , GPE ekin ” ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG DATE which had responsibility under the LAW for ensuring the fairness of elections DATE decided that the ORG satisfied all the conditions necessary to take part in the general election of DATE . The party consequently ran an election campaign .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG applied to ORG for a second time for an order dissolving the ORG . He accused the party of having carried on activities likely to undermine the territorial integrity of the ORG and the unity of the nation contrary to Articles CARDINAL , DATE , DATE and DATE and former LAW , and sections CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) of PERSON no . PERSON .

In support of his application , ORG relied in particular on the following extracts from the ORG 's election publications and from oral statements made by its Chairman , PERSON , at public meetings and on television .

“ ... Dear friends , ... the second dynamic is the NORP dynamic . It is the call for equality and freedom , [ it is ] the NORP ' claim to rights as a nation . It is a request that the rights which the NORP enjoy ... be granted to the NORP also .

At DATE , a war of independence was waged ... in circumstances in which imperialists occupied the country and NORP and NORP depended on one another and had to unite and fight , side by side . The LAW provided : ' The homeland is composed of the lands where the NORP and the NORP live . ' At the GPE and ORG , oral and written declarations were made recognising the ethnic social and geographical rights of NORP ... once the war was over and the men had hung up their weapons , an official ideology developed ... as though there was no longer any need for people from GPE , GPE or ORG to fight ... Under that official ideology , there was no longer any room for NORP . There were no more NORP . Henceforth , only NORP existed ... ” ( pages CARDINAL–CARDINAL )

“ ... they can make this country ... a homeland of cultures , brotherhood , workers , [ a homeland ] where there is voluntary unity , where nations freely decide on their future and freely unite if they so wish ... Long live brotherhood between NORP and NORP ! Long live the NORP and NORP peoples ! ” ( page CARDINAL )

“ ... The collapse started where the regime was most tyrannical and most vulnerable . The [ political ] parties of the status quo failed to the east of the LOC ... [ They ] are no longer to be seen in the lands where the NORP people live ... ( page CARDINAL )

Why have the parties of the status quo disappeared from the NORP provinces ? Because they are nationalists ... NORP nationalism has become bankrupt in the lands where the NORP problem will be resolved . NORP nationalism has drawn its borders . It has divided ORG into CARDINAL parts , situated to the east and west of the LOC . NORP nationalism and its regime are in the process of drowning in the LOC . That is what is known as a bankrupt regime . ( page CARDINAL )

... After the mountains , the ORG also lost the villages and towns . That is why it counts directly on deterring the masses . ORG terror seeks to establish a new regime in GPE , starting from the east ... ( page CARDINAL )

The ORG pays village guards and special forces ... which it feeds to kill NORP through the taxes it collects from the people . The cost of the bullets fired at NORP , of petrol used in cross - border operations ... , in short , the cost of [ this ] special war is borne by the people ... To bring inflation and ... poverty to an end , a peaceful solution must be found to the NORP problem . The NORP problem is at the same time a NORP problem ... Living freely , in brotherhood , heart to heart , in peace and harmony with the NORP people is a need ... for the NORP people ... NORP and NORP are but CARDINAL people . No Turk will be entitled to enter paradise if a single NORP [ still ] remains in hell . ORG is determined to fight until the last NORP is saved from hell . ( pages CARDINAL )

ORG is present on both sides of the LOC . It is the party of brotherhood between NORP and NORP . ORG determination in the face of the NORP problem has been demonstrated by its fight to combat ORG pressure on the NORP nation ... , its shared destiny in the poor NORP peasants ' fight for survival ... , the fact that it has overcome the barrier of fear by holding meetings with CARDINAL of people in the NORP villages and towns and has explained the NORP problem to working people throughout GPE ... Our party imparts this awareness . It sees a solution in the common destiny of peoples and their combat . To remedy the NORP problem , ORG has courage , ... a cause and a programme . ( pages CARDINAL )

The NORP nation has a full and unconditional right to self - determination . It may , if it wishes , create a separate ORG . The interest of the proletariat lies in the establishment , through democratic popular revolution , of a voluntary union founded on absolute equality of rights and freedoms . The right to secede is , at all times , an essential condition of that voluntary union .

Whether or not people live together depends on the free will of nations . So that that will can be expressed , a referendum must be organised in the NORP provinces . During the referendum , those who are in favour of secession must also be allowed freely to express their views .

Under current historical conditions , a solution favourable to the workers of both nations lies in a democratic federal republic , to which the CARDINAL federated GPE adhere on an equal footing . In the federation , power will be exercised through popular assemblies elected democratically by districts , towns , federated GPE and the federal ORG , beginning with the neighbourhoods and villages .
The prefectures and sub - prefectures , ORG governments and the federal government will be the executive bodies of those assemblies and accountable to them .
The popular federal assembly will be composed of CARDINAL assemblies : the assembly of the members of parliament and the assembly of the nations .
The assembly of the members of parliament will be elected in a general election with CARDINAL member of parliament elected by a given number of citizens .
The assembly of nations will be constituted by an equal number of members elected from each of the CARDINAL GPE .
Legislation will be enacted on a majority vote in the CARDINAL assemblies .
Legislation which is rejected by CARDINAL of the assemblies will not come into force .
The Employment Code , and ORG will apply throughout the country and be adopted by the federal bodies .
In those districts and provinces of each ORG where minority groups are in the majority , regional self - determination will be permitted if the people so desire .

The federal LAW will be the common LAW of the CARDINAL nations . It will come into force as soon it has been accepted , by referendum , by a majority in each of the CARDINAL nations . Each ORG will also have its own LAW . LAW will cover an increasing number of matters , to the extent that the federated republics consent thereto .

The flag and national anthem of the federal republic will be the same for NORP and NORP . Each federated ORG will have its own flag and anthem . The federation shall not have a name that refers to CARDINAL of the nations .
Defence of the country , issues of war and peace , and entry into representative treaties in international relations will be the responsibility of the federal bodies .
Each federated ORG will [ however ] be entitled to establish direct commercial and cultural relations with foreign countries and to open consulates .

At each level of government , power will lie solely with the popular assemblies and the local authorities accountable to them . The prefecture , sub - prefectures , security forces and gendarmerie established under the current [ central ] government outside the scope of the proposed administrative system will be abolished . This democratic administrative system will also guarantee national equality and freedom .

Local security forces will receive their orders from local government authorities and be accountable to local assemblies . In the villages , security forces will be composed of local young people , who will receive instructions from village committees .

Seigniory , dependence on the head of a clan or any form of medieval relation that is incompatible with brotherhood or social development shall be abolished by an agrarian reform to be undertaken by the mobilisation of farmers under the direction of the village committees .

In order that regional inequalities that have been aggravated by the market economy may be removed , the federal republic will increase its share of investment in regions that are economically underdeveloped . It will therefore guarantee and develop the economic basis of the union .
With respect to the economy , a federal system of uniform statistics will be used .
The freedom and right of each nation and each national or religious minority to develop its language and culture and to pursue political and associative activities will be guaranteed .

The official languages will be NORP and NORP . Each federated republic will have its own language as its official language . Decisions of the federal bodies will be drafted in both languages . From primary school to university and in all cultural institutions , means of education , research and communication , such as journalism , publishing , radio and television , etc . , will be provided in both languages .

The democratic culture of the NORP nation will be able to develop through the removal of the pressures that have been exerted on it up till now . Those in power will strive for free democratic cultural exchange with NORP and NORP in other countries and an international culture common to all nations of the world to flourish in a pluralist and active environment .

All bodies in power will endeavour [ on the one hand ] to eradicate , with all its foundations , the former culture idolising violence and advocating the use of force to solve problems between nations and in society and [ on the other hand ] to spread among the people an internationalist proletarian culture that respects mankind and despises violence .

Against the fundamentalist nationalist culture according to which the history of the lands in which we live began with the war of ORG and against all other forms of nationalism will be developed an internationalist , universal , humanitarian and democratic culture that will seek new cultural sources , enriched by the contribution of different peoples stemming from the historic depths of our country , and will draw on those resources . Original names will no longer be changed as they reflect the wealth of our country 's universal culture ; every place will be called by its known , established name . ” ( pages CARDINAL–CARDINAL )

“ ORG is the last bridge between the NORP and NORP people ... The current status quo has failed with respect to the NORP problem and its deafening collapse can be heard from here ... What is the only possible solution ? ... This issue can only be resolved by respecting the wish of the NORP people ... the real remedy lies with the NORP people . We will ask the NORP : ' What do you want ? ' ... if , conversely , they seek secession , we will respect their wish . We will organise a referendum . We will ask the NORP people ... , everyone , from PERSON to NORP : ' Do you want to create a separate ORG in our land or not ? ' ORG prefers unification ... Who is inciting secession ? Oppression [ is ] . The oppression of the NORP people by ORG . We will defend unification by putting an end to that oppression and that will be proof of [ our ] acceptance of the NORP people 's will ... ORG will defend the union of the CARDINAL peoples within the federation and the joint [ exercise ] of power ... ORG is the last bridge between the NORP and NORP people ... No party other than ORG has shared the NORP ' destiny , taken up a position against ORG or is able to maintain that position . ”

“ ... Let us now define [ what they call ] internal security . That is the NORP problem . If you put it in terms of internal security ... , you will have recourse to the gendarmes . If the problem is seen as a NORP one , you will resolve it by democracy and freedom . In fact , it is the present regime that has transformed the LOC into a border ... It was an economic border ... Then , they made the LOC a political border ... and , lastly , an ideological one ... NORP nationalism has drowned in the LOC ; it can not cross it ... because nationalism has no place in these lands ... There is a NORP problem but also a NORP problem ... a fraternal solution will come from ORG . The [ other ] CARDINAL parties have become separatist ... because they were nationalist . We offer a fraternal solution , a federation . The NORP nation should be given the right to self - determination . That is how the right conditions for unification will come about ... Union can not be achieved through force . Your solutions have failed . You will see , the ORG solution will prevail . ”

“ ... we will put a stop to the special war being [ waged ] in the east ... we will end it by replacing it with a programme of brotherhood between NORP and NORP ... and , lastly , on a structural level , a federation in which both nations are on an equal footing ... They say that they are troubled by the fact that the LOC is a border . Who made the LOC a border ? They did ! ... PERSON , voluntary union on an equal footing of the NORP and NORP nations within a federation , provided that the NORP nation consents and so decides as master of its destiny and accepts it : that is the solution proposed by ORG . The CARDINAL peoples , CARDINAL nations are obliged [ to accept ] ... ”

“ ... Because the NORP of the village of Botan are standing up they are in the process of becoming their own masters ... Is it you , the status quo , that has forbidden the use of the name ' NORP ' ? The NORP people are standing up ; they are becoming the centre of the debate ; through their acts , they are imposing their identity and celebrating the PERSON ... The oppressed NORP are establishing their LAW , making laws . ”

“ ... ORG says that the NORP problem can not be resolved by soldiers or bullets . The solution lies in independence ... in equality . The NORP and NORP nations should have the same rights . The NORP and NORP nations will form a popular republic ... and then one of them will survive and the other be oppressed ; that is indefensible ... It is ORG that is with the oppressed NORP people ... By standing up , the NORP people have begun to demonstrate the combat they have been waging for DATE ... The NORP people will bring about a new revolution ... The oppressed NORP people ... are coming to join ORG ... Long live the awakening ! Long live our people ! ”

“ ... NORP nationalism has drowned in the LOC ... The ORG has oppressed the NORP people to the point of erasing their name , even of prohibiting its use ; but bans come to nothing ... The NORP reality is there and is asserting itself ... NORP and NORP remain brothers ; there can be no brotherhood where there is slavery ; there can be no brotherhood if one is master and the other slave ; everyone should be equal and have the same rights ... There can be no hope if NORP and NORP do not unite ... This equation should be noted down somewhere : the NORP people plus the oppressed NORP people equals democracy , independence and freedom ... Long live GPE ! ... ”
Relying on an audiovisual recording of the latter meeting , PERSON nevertheless denied , at a hearing before FAC on DATE , that he had uttered the last sentence .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG sent ORG application to the ORG , whose counsel filed preliminary written observations on DATE and full observations on DATE , in which they first requested a hearing or , at the very least , leave to make further submissions orally . ORG acceded to the latter request only and heard the party Chairman , PERSON , on DATE , who had ceased to be Chairman of the party a short time before .

Before the Constitutional Court the ORG 's representatives firstly contested the constitutionality of certain provisions of Law no . PERSON on which ORG relied . They also argued that the court should not admit the ORG 's publications ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) in evidence against that party . They said that CARDINAL of the publications were copies of a speech made by PERSON before his election as party Chairman on DATE ; furthermore , they had been examined by ORG and found not to contravene the law ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .

The party representatives went on to point out that on DATE ORG had dismissed the first application to have the ORG dissolved on the basis of its programme ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . They maintained that the court would be contradicting itself if it now decided to dissolve the ORG purely because of PERSON oral statements , which , in the case before the court , were merely reiterations of paragraph CARDINAL of the programme , which had already been reviewed by ORG . They noted , lastly , that since the enactment of PERSON no . ORG ( the Prevention of Terrorism Act ) which had , in particular , repealed LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , it was no longer illegal to carry on ORG activities ; in their submission , if CARDINAL political party was treated differently from the others , the aim pursued by the NORP legislature would be defeated .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to section CARDINAL of Law no . PERSON , ORG made an order on DATE dissolving the ORG , which entailed ipso jure the liquidation of the party and the transfer of its assets to the ORG , in accordance with LAW . The order was published in ORG on DATE . As a consequence , the founders and managers of the party were banned from holding similar office in any other political body ( former LAW see paragraph QUANTITY below ) .

In its judgment ORG noted at the outset that the impugned publications of the ORG bore the name and signature of its Chairman , PERSON , who was also the person who had made the oral statements on television . Those publications and statements accordingly also bound the ORG and consequently were admissible as relevant evidence under LAW no . PERSON .

ORG did not consider that either its or ORG earlier judgments ( see paragraphs CARDINAL–CARDINAL above ) in any way affected its examination of the case before it , which concerned the political activities of the party , not of its leaders . Moreover , it could not accept that the fact that a provision of LAW making it an offence to behave in a certain way had been repealed meant that similar conduct no longer constituted a valid ground for dissolution under PERSON no . PERSON .

ORG observed that unlike the issue that had been decided in its judgment of CARDINAL DATE , the one now before it was based on new facts and evidence and thus gave rise to a different question in law . It no longer had to be determined whether the programme and constitution of the ORG were in conformity with the law , but solely whether its political activities were caught by the relevant prohibitions .

In reaching its decision on the merits , ORG noted , inter alia , that the ORG referred in its political message to CARDINAL nations : the NORP nation and the NORP nation . But it could not be accepted that there were QUANTITY nations within GPE , whose citizens , whatever their ethnic origin , had NORP nationality . In reality , the statements made by the ORG concerning NORP national and cultural rights were intended to create minorities and , ultimately , the establishment of a NORP - Turkish federation , to the detriment of the unity of the NORP nation and the territorial integrity of ORG .

Like all nationals of foreign descent , nationals of NORP origin could freely express their identity , but the LAW and the law precluded them from forming a separate nation and ORG . The ORG was ideologically opposed to the nationalism of PERSON , which was the most fundamental principle underpinning GPE .

The ORG 's political activity was also incompatible in aim with LAW and CARDINAL of LAW , since it was similar to that of terrorist organisations , notwithstanding a difference in the means employed .

In short , objectives which , like those of the ORG , encouraged separatism and incited a socially integrated community to fight for the creation of an independent federated ORG were unacceptable and justified dissolution of the party concerned .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW read as follows :

“ GPE is a democratic , secular and social ORG based on the rule of law , respectful of human rights in a spirit of social peace , national solidarity and justice , adhering to the nationalism of PERSON and resting on the fundamental principles set out in the Preamble . ”
“ The State of GPE shall constitute with its territory and nation , an indivisible whole . The official language shall be NORP . ”

“ No amendment may be made or proposed to the provisions of LAW providing that the ORG shall be a Republic , the provisions of LAW concerning the characteristics of the LOC or the provisions of LAW . ”
“ Sovereignty shall reside unconditionally and unreservedly in the nation .
Sovereign power shall not under any circumstances be transferred to an individual , a group or a social class ... ”

“ All individuals shall be equal before the law without any distinction based on language , race , colour , sex , political opinion , philosophical belief , religion , membership of a religious sect or other similar grounds . ”

“ None of the rights and freedoms referred to in the LAW shall be exercised with a view to undermining the territorial integrity of the ORG and the unity of the nation , jeopardising the existence of ORG , abolishing fundamental rights and freedoms , placing the control of the ORG in the hands of a single individual or group , ensuring the domination of CARDINAL social class over other social classes , introducing discrimination on the grounds of language , race , religion or membership of a religious sect , or establishing by any other means a political system based on any of the above concepts and opinions . ”
“ Everyone linked to ORG by nationality shall be NORP . ”
No political party shall be formed which aims to advocate or establish the domination of CARDINAL social class or group , or any form of dictatorship ... ”

“ Political parties shall not engage in activities other than those referred to in their constitutions and programmes , nor shall they disregard the restrictions laid down by LAW , on pain of permanent dissolution .
The decisions and internal running of political parties shall not be contrary to democratic principles .

Immediately a political party is formed , ORG shall verify as a matter of priority that its constitution and programme and the legal position of its founding members are consistent with the LAW and the laws of the land . He shall also monitor its activities .
Political parties may be dissolved by ORG , on an application by ORG .

Founding members and managers , at whatever level , of political parties which have been permanently dissolved may not become founding members , managers or financial controllers of any new political party ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of Law no . CARDINAL on the regulation of political parties read as follows :
“ Political parties
( a ) shall not aim , strive or incite third parties to

change the NORP form of ORG ; the ... provisions concerning the absolute integrity of ORG territory , the absolute unity of its nation , its official language , its flag or its national anthem ; ... the principle that sovereignty resides unconditionally and unreservedly in the NORP nation ; ... the provision that sovereign power can not be transferred to an individual , a group or a social class ... ;

jeopardise the existence of ORG , abolish fundamental rights and freedoms , introduce discrimination on grounds of language , race , colour , religion or membership of a religious sect , or establish , by any means , a system of government based on any such notion or concept .

( c ) shall not aim to defend or establish the domination of CARDINAL social class over the other social classes or the domination of a community or the setting up of any form of dictatorship ; they shall not carry on activities in pursuit of such aims ... ”
“ Political parties shall not aim to change the principle of the unitary ORG on which GPE is founded , nor carry on activities in pursuit of such an aim . ”
“ Political parties shall not

( a ) assert that there exist within the territory of GPE any national minorities based on differences relating to national or religious culture , membership of a religious sect , race or language ; or

( b ) aim to destroy national unity by proposing , on the pretext of protecting , promoting or disseminating a non - NORP language or culture , to create minorities on the territory of GPE or to engage in similar activities ... ”
“ The constitution , programme and activities of political parties may not contravene the LAW or this PERSON . ”
“ The Constitutional Court shall dissolve a political party whose
( a ) constitution or programme ... is contrary to the provisions of LAW this PERSON ;

( b ) ORG membership , central committee or executive committee ... take a decision , issue a circular or make a statement ... contrary to the provisions of LAW ... , or whose Chairman , Vice - Chairman or ORG Secretary makes any written or oral statement contrary to those provisions ...
( c ) NORP representative appointed ... by the administrative committee ... , makes oral statements on radio or television that are contrary to the provisions ... of this Law ... ”
“ All the assets of political parties dissolved by order of the Constitutional Court shall be transferred to the ORG . ”
LAW , which is referred to in LAW , includes in particular section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) , which is reproduced above .
CARDINAL . At the material time LAW provided :
“ Harmful propaganda

CARDINAL . A person who by any means whatsoever spreads propaganda with a view to establishing the domination of CARDINAL social class over the others , annihilating a social class , overturning the fundamental social or economic order established in GPE or destroying the entire political or judicial order of the ORG shall , on conviction , be liable to a term of imprisonment of CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . A person who by any means whatsoever spreads propaganda in favour of the ORG 's being governed by an individual or social group to the detriment of republicanism or democratic principles shall , on conviction , be liable to a term of imprisonment of DATE .

CARDINAL . Any person who by any means whatsoever spreads propaganda inspired by racist theories aimed at abolishing in whole or in part public - law rights as guaranteed by the LAW or undermining or eliminating patriotic sentiment shall , on conviction , be liable to a term of imprisonment of DATE .
